title: Can I sell an already written book on Amazon Kindle by some other author? - Quora

response.answer_text: The only scenario where this is possible, as far as I can see, is if the author has for some reason appointed you a representative. In such a case, you can sell his or her book after discussing it with him or her and drawing up some legal agreement. However this is someone else’s work. So, if the above is not true, you can’t sell it. In other words, if your question is “Can I make money on Amazon by selling a book written by someone else?”, the answer is a strict NO. You will find yourself in all sorts of legal entanglements, and perhaps rightly so. On the other hand if your question is “I’ve purchased a kindle edition of a book by an author, and can I sell it to someone else?”, again the answer is NO. However Amazon allows lending of a sort; you can lend books using KOLL (and the decision on whether lending can be done or not is up to the author who published it on KDP, not you). You will not be making any money of this. Note: I am not an Amazon representative, but I know enough of the rules to be sure of the answers above.

Only if you own the rights to the book. Putting up a book that someone else owns can get you in legal trouble (and rightfully so, as you're stealing someone else's work). Putting up public domain material is against Amazon's terms of service (although you can add your own content to make it a new work, such as copies of Shakespeare's plays that have notes on what the older words mean)

Ideally no. This way you are violationg the copyright. The author or the publication house can demand a compensation from you for their loss. However, there are lot of books that are copyright free. You can publish them on kindle, but only after mentioning the original author name/s. A few examples of such books are The Power of your Subconscious Mind by Joseph Murphy, Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill etc.

Hello! The books published by another author is their copyright and publishing their book is not allowed. If you have a valid reason, approach the author and the publisher of their book. Kindly do not publish anyone’s work without their consent. You will be sued for it.

If it is a book in the public domain, then yes. Say your name is ABC, you can publish ABC version of “Homer’s Odyssey” or “Kautilya’s Arthashashtra”, provided you use the source material that is in the public domain and mention it as such.
